intro: Maesa ziroensis, commonly known as the Ziro maesa, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
